item.title: Traps Found
item.dc:creator: @NOURLOL NOURLOL
item.description:
@NOURLOL wrote:

Dunno, replace:

invokevirtual int java.lang.reflect.Field.getAccessModifiers

with like

invokestatic int HackClass.getHackedModifiers(java.lang.Field)

And then like:

int getHackedModifiers(Field f) { if(f.isPublic()) return Modifiers.ACC_PRIVATE; // + the original else return f.getModifiers; }

For say, the purposes of publicizing

Read full topic

item.title: Traps Found
item.dc:creator: @Krichevskoy Krichevskoy
item.description:
@Krichevskoy wrote:

Nerice:

Been known since right after the change, not to run a renamed client.

Known, but not really documented. So now everyone knows exactly what they do (positively Wardonesque, isn’t it?) Wonder what happens if you simply fail to respond to these packets, or if you set that variable to whatever an existing class would make it…

Read full topic

item.title: Traps Found
item.dc:creator: @defyboy defyboy
item.description:
@defyboy wrote:

Looking at the data dumped from my framedump client (#423), Ive noticed a few off looking frames:

DEC FRAME(233) Word_U(11) Byte_U(1) DWord_U(6) Byte_U(2) String("bd") String("a")
DEC FRAME(233) Word_U(11) Byte_U(1) DWord_U(7) Byte_U(2) String("td") String("M")
DEC FRAME(233) Word_U(12) Byte_U(1) DWord_U(8) Byte_U(0) String("hd") String("hd")

These appeared to be names of original classes and methods, Which the server is sending to the client randomly.

This is an extract of the method that parses it (method404 in Class40, Deob #423).

		} catch (ClassNotFoundException classnotfoundexception) {
		    class63_sub5.anIntArray1951[i_23_] = -1;
		} catch (SecurityException securityexception) {
		    class63_sub5.anIntArray1951[i_23_] = -2;
		} catch (NullPointerException nullpointerexception) {
		    class63_sub5.anIntArray1951[i_23_] = -3;
		} catch (Exception exception) {
		    class63_sub5.anIntArray1951[i_23_] = -4;
		} catch (Throwable throwable) {
		    class63_sub5.anIntArray1951[i_23_] = -5;
		}

It appears that It recieves the class names, and tries to initiate the class, and report if it doesnt exist, I still havent been banned, But jagex knows that im using a deob.

I havent tried to work a way around it yet, But I will post here if I do.

Read full topic
